meanings.definition: Absorb all the attention or interest of
meanings.sent1: The captivating story completely engrossed the children.
meanings.sent2: The thrilling movie engrossed the audience from start to finish.
meanings.sent3: The magician's tricks were so engrossing that the audience couldn't look away.
meanings.sent4: The mystery novel engrossed me like a whirlpool, pulling me deeper into its plot.
meanings.sent5: The beautiful artwork had an engrossing effect, making it hard to focus on anything else.

meanings.definition: Write or transcribe in a large, clear hand
meanings.sent1: She carefully engrossed her name on the certificate.
meanings.sent2: The scribe would engross important documents for the king.
meanings.sent3: The calligrapher's skillful hand engrossed the elegant script on the wedding invitations.
meanings.sent4: The artist would engross intricate designs on parchment with precision.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's neat handwriting engrossed the students as they copied notes from the board.

meanings.definition: To purchase all of the available supply of (a particular product)
meanings.sent1: The eager shoppers quickly engrossed all the limited edition sneakers.
meanings.sent2: The collectors would engross rare stamps to add to their collection.
meanings.sent3: The holiday sale engrossed customers, leading to a rush for the discounted items.
meanings.sent4: The auction house would engross valuable paintings for private buyers.
meanings.sent5: The bookstore owner decided to engross the bestselling novel to meet the high demand.
